component.description: Category of metadata level (e.g., study level, file level, etc.); provide the same one for all items/rows.

relatedStudies.description: The synIDs of related studies OR names of related studies not in Synapse

studyID.description: The stable, unique identifier for a study that never changes, even if other study metadata changes (like the study name, short name, owner, or project). Example: STUDY_SCA

studyKey.description: The short acronym for a project the study is associated with.

studyDescription.description: The synID of the wiki that contains the study description.Description of the study, including the types of experimental assays, model systems, types of analysis, description of cohort, associated vulnerable populations, special categories of data, rare diseases, etc. Maps to DUOplus2.

studyAbstract.description: The short study description/abstract used to describe the study that is visible on the Portal study card.

studyMetadata.description: The wiki from the CLASSIC Portal - backend that describes study metadata files

principalInvestigatorRoles.description: Distinguishes original vs current vs co-PI

protocolDescription.description: The synID of the wiki that contains the protocol, study design and goals

diseaseFocus.description: Primary disease or condition focus of the study. A categorical descriptor summarizing participant health status selection and ascertainment context for a study cohort, intended to support discovery and comparison across studies.

primaryHealthFocus.description: Why participants were included: these categories describe participant health status at enrollment, not outcomes.

ascertainmentContext.description: Where participants came from: the categories describe sampling context, independent of diseas focus

dataType.description: Types of input/output data in bioinformatics pipelines

dataSubtype.description: Further qualification of dataType, which may be used to indicate the state of processing of the data, aggregation of the data, or presence of metadata.

metadataType.description: For files of dataSubtype: metadata, a description of the type of metadata in the file.

metadataFileID.description: Identifies a specific metadata artifact or file (i.e, a particular "measures.tsv" version, etc. If the file is uploaded to Synapse, this will be the Synapse file entity ID. Examples: syn99887766 (or FILE_STUDY_SCA_measures_v2)

metadataCoverageScope.description: Indicates whether the archived metadata describes all data collected in the study or only the data types made available for external access.

metadataCoverageNotes.description: Free-text clarification of what is included/excluded in the metadata record and why (e.g., “some measures collected but not shareable due to licensing”).

externallyRequestable.description: Availability indicator to request the data.

irbApprovalNumber.description: The identifier assigned by the IRB for an approved or reviewed study, if applicable.

irbStatus.description: The regulatory determination of IRB oversight for the study.

irbInstitution.description: The institution or ethics committee responsible for IRB review or determination.

irbExemptionType.description: The regulatory exemption category under which the study was determined to be exempt from IRB review.

irbApprovalDescription.description: Free-text description providing additional context about IRB approval, exemption, or oversight.

irbScope.description: Scope of IRB in relation to the study.

accessProcedure.description: Brief description of the steps required to request and obtain access to the dataset.

accessRequestURL.description: URL to the access request page/portal or repository instructions for obtaining access.

dataLocation.description: Where the dataset is hosted or distributed (e.g., Synapse project, NIMH/NDAR collection, dbGaP).

accessContact.description: Point of contact (team, email alias, or role) for access questions.

accessReviewBody.description: The entity that reviews/approves access requests (e.g., DAC, IRB, sponsor).

accessRequirements.description: Checklist of materials required for access (e.g., DUA, IRB letter, training).

appliesTo.description: Indicates the level of entity to which a metadata value applies (e.g., individual participant or population summary).

aggregationLevel.description: Specifies whether a metadata value represents individual-level data or an aggregate summary

populationScope.description: Identifies the population described by the metadata (e.g., study-wide, cohort, or study arm).

populationType.description: Broad classification of the population sampled in the study/cohort.

populationDescriptor.description: Free-text descriptor capturing key population characteristics not covered by controlled terms (e.g., “male veterans”, “older adults with caregiver support”).

dataAvailabilitySummary.description: An aggregate description of the amount and demographic composition of available data for a study, cohort, or variable, provided without individual-level records.

temporalCoverage.description: The time period or periods during which data were collected for a study, cohort, or variable, summarized at an aggregate level.

startYear.description: Earliest calendar year of data collection

endYear.description: Latest calendar year of data collection

years.description: Explicit list of years, if non-continuous. Four-digit integers (e.g., 2019)

seasons.description: Seasons during which data were collected

participantID.description: De-identified participant ID; unique to a specific study or program

totalParticipants.description: The total number of unique participants for whom data are available within the specified study, cohort, or scope.

externalParticipantID.description: Other external identifier, if no GUID exists

GUID.description: Global Unique Identifier: unique across studies and repositories. If a participant has been assigned a global identifier (e.g., NDAR GUID), include it here to support linkage across studies and repositories. Otherwise, leave this field blank.

enrollmentAge.description: The age or ages of a participant at the time of enrollment or at defined enrollment-related timepoints in a study, including single ages, age ranges, or multiple ages associated with longitudinal or staged enrollment.

enrollmentTimepoint.description: A named study milestone at which enrollment occurs (e.g., baseline, re-enrollment, extension phase).

administrationContext.description: The physical or situational setting in which a data collection activity or assessment is administered. Describes where data collection occurs, not how, who, or what. Intended for general or summary-level reporting, not per-participant metadata.

propotion.description: A numeric value representing the fraction of a population associated with a given category, typically expressed as a percentage or decimal.

ageGroup.description: Broad age-based population grouping represented in the cohort.

sex.description: The biological classification of a participant, typically assigned at birth based on physical and genetic characteristics.

sexDistribution.description: A summary of the proportion or count of participants in a population by sex category.
sexDistribution.x-sageNotes:
Example:
sexDistribution:
  appliesTo: cohort
  categories:
    - value: Female
      proportion: 0.6
    - value: Male
      proportion: 0.4

sexEligible.description: Sex eligibility criteria for cohort inclusion (if the study restricts enrollment).

gender.description: The socially and culturally constructed identity that describes a person’s self-identified gender, which may or may not correspond to sex assigned at birth and may change over time.

genderDistribution.description: A summary of the proportion or count of participants in a population by self-identified gender.

enum: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

race.description: Self-reported race/ethnicity. A socially defined classification that reflects a participant’s self-identified racial group(s), based on shared social, historical, or cultural experiences, and not biological or genetic differences.

raceDistribution.description: A summary of the proportion or count of participants in a population by self-identified race category or categories.

ethnicity.description: Self-reported race/ethnicity. A self-identified cultural classification that reflects whether a participant identifies as being of Hispanic or Latino origin, independent of race.

ethnicityDistribution.description: A summary of the proportion or count of participants in a population by self-identified ethnicity.

collectionModailty.description: The primary mode by which data were collected for a variable or assessment.

generation.description: Generation within family cohort (ex., F0=original, F1=child, F2=grandchild). Indicates the generational position of participants within a family-based cohort, relative to the originally enrolled participant(s).

relationToOriginal.description: Relationship to original participant (ex., self, child, grandchild, spouse). Describes the familial relationship(s) of participants to the initially enrolled participant(s) in a family-based cohort.

recruitmentWave.description: Enrollment wave (baseline, follow-up, etc.). Identifies the recruitment phase or wave during which participants were enrolled in a study, reflecting distinct enrollment periods defined by study design or operational milestones.

studyWaves.description: The recruitment or enrollment wave(s) represented in the study population.

studyWaveID.description: A stable identifier for a defined recruitment wave or enrollment phase within a study. Examples: WAVE:1, WAVE:2, WAVE:PILOT, WAVE:EXTENSION

studyPeriodID.description: A stable identifier for a defined time period during which data collection occurred under consistent procedures or conditions. Examples: PERIOD:BASELINE, PERIOD:FOLLOWUP_6MO, PERIOD:COVID_ERA, PERIOD:2020_2021

studyArmID.description: A stable identifier for a defined study arm, group, or condition assignment used to structure participant enrollment, intervention, or comparison. Examples: ARM:CONTROL, ARM:TREATMENT_A, ARM:HIGH_RISK, ARM:CASE, ARM:COMPARATOR

studyComponentID.description: A stable identifier for a defined component of a study (e.g., wave, arm, period) used to scope metadata summaries.

studyComponentType.description: The category of study subcomponent identified by studyComponentID (e.g., wave, arm, period), used to indicate what kind of study structure the component represents for scoping metadata summaries.

followUpYear.description: Years since original cohort enrollment. Summarizes the amount of time elapsed since original cohort enrollment for which participant data are available.

deviceType.description: The type of digital device used for data collection, applicable only when data are collected digitally.
deviceType.x-sageNotes: Device used (smartphone, wearable, etc.); applied only when collectionModality = Digital

softwarePlatform.description: The software environment or application used to deliver, collect, or manage digitally collected data.

inputMethod.description: The primary method by which participant input or data capture occurs during digital data collection.

administrationMode.description: The manner in which a digital assessment or data collection activity is administered to participants.

measuredConstruct.description: A conceptual domain or construct that a study collected data on (e.g., depression, working memory, physical activity).

constructDescription.description: One-sentence description of how the construct was operationalized in the study.

measureType.description: The general type of measure used to assess a construct.

isValidatedMeasure.description: Indicates whether a measure or instrument used to assess a construct has been previously validated.

measureDescription.description: A brief description of how a measure was administered and what it was designed to assess.

derivedScore.description: A summary description of a score derived from a measure, including how it was calculated.

derivationMethod.description: A high-level description of how a score was derived from raw or intermediate data.

scoreName.description: Is the human-readable name of a score derived from a measure, as used or labeled by the study.

scoreType.description: Describes the general method or form by which a score was derived from a measure or assessment.

instrumentID.description: a stable identifier used to reference a specific instrument, measure, or assessment used in a study (e.g., a validated questionnaire, cognitive task, interview protocol, or sensor-based assessment).

instrumentName.description: Name of the instrument or scale used (e.g., PHQ-9, NIH Toolbox).

instrumentCitation.description: The primary citation(s) describing the instrument/task implementation used in the study (e.g., published paper, manual, DOI).

instrumentVersion.description: Version identifier for the instrument implementation used (e.g., vendor version, protocol revision, “v2”, “2016 revision”).

stimulusResponseMode.description: How participants interacted with the instrument during administration.

administrationInstructions.description: The instructions provided to participants describing exactly how to perform the instrument/task (verbatim or summarized).

administrationProcedure.description: The source of the implementation (e.g., NIH Toolbox, PEBL, PsychoPy script, custom app).

protocolURL.description: Link to the protocol, manual, script, or documentation describing the instrument implementation.

derivedVariableName.description: The name of a derived variable or score as it appears in the dataset or metadata record.

derivedVariableType.description: A controlled category describing the general method or type of derivation used to compute a derived variable or score (e.g., sum score, composite score, standardized score).

variableSummary.description: Aggregate summary statistics describing the observed distribution and availability of a variable in a dataset, without exposing participant-level values.

valueRange.description: The observed minimum and maximum values of a continuous variable within the reported population scope.

valueRangeMinValue.description: The minimum observed value of a continuous variable within the specified population scope.

valueRangeMaxValue.description: The maximum observed value of a continuous variable within the specified population scope.

unit.description: The unit of measurement associated with a variable’s values or summary statistics (e.g., years, kg/m²).

timepoint.description: A label identifying the study timepoint or phase at which the variable value or summary applies (e.g., baseline, follow-up).

rollingEnrollment.description: Indicates whether participant enrollment occurs continuously over time rather than within a fixed recruitment window.

studyStartYear.description: The calendar year in which study recruitment or data collection began. Use "Unknown" if not available.

burstDesign.description: A summary description of the study’s burst-based sampling structure (bursts, timing, follow-up cadence, and recruitment waves).

numberOfBursts.description: The number of distinct burst periods of intensive measurement scheduled per participant.

burstLength.description: The planned duration of each burst period of intensive measurement.

burstFrequency.description: The planned frequency at which bursts occur across the study timeline.

followUpInterval.description: The planned amount of time between participant follow-up assessments, visits, or measurement periods.

hasObservationTimestamp.description: Indicates whether individual observations/records include a date or timestamp of data collection.

eligibilityCriteriaSummary.description: A brief summary of the major inclusion and exclusion criteria that determined who could enroll in the study/cohort.

eligibilityCriteriaURL.description: Link to the protocol, registry record, or document containing full inclusion/exclusion criteria.

inclusionTags.description: High-level inclusion characteristics used to define the enrolled population.

exclusionTags.description: High-level exclusion characteristics used to restrict enrollment.
